title: Interest rates and balance of payment

content.question: Assume that a nation’s capital and financial account is in balance. If the nation’s central bank implements contractionary monetary policy, which of the following will occur solely as a result of the change in the nation’s interest rates?

choices.label: There will be an increase in financial capital outflows.
The balance of payments will be greater than zero.
Both the current account and the capital and financial account will move into deficit.
International investors will buy less of the nation’s financial assets.
The capital and financial account will move into surplus.

content.answer: The capital and financial account will move into surplus.
